intro: Brassica rapa var. sarson, commonly known as black mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and seed pods. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with alternating leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its seeds, which are small and black, are used in various traditional and medicinal applications. The plant is also known for its rapid growth cycle and adaptability to a wide range of soil types.
